response.answer_text: My wife wanted a lightweight, fast laptop. In my research I identified a number of machines, including the Asus UX301LA. A nice machine with a great screen, a nice keyboard and super fast startup. I got a 500GB machine, two 250GB SSD set up as Raid 0. It was such a nice machine I bought a second one for myself a month or two later. We then went overseas. A little over a year later, after the warranty expired, my wife’s machine starts acting up, hanging on startup and other issues. Then it died - would not boot. One of the proprietary flashdrive SSDs failed, and because it was raid 0 there was nothing to recover from the other disk. I took the machine back to the US and sent it to an Asus approved repair center. They tried to order a replacement 250 GB SSD. It was not available before I had to leave, so I had them set it up using the 250 GB SSD. Shortly thereafter the other machine started having SSD errors. That failed, and both SSDs were unusable. I then went online and bought a “new” 125 GB SSD, there were no 250 GB SSDs available. I set it up with Linux. I bought a used 125 GB SSD with the idea of expanding it to 250 GB but that was DOA and I returned it. Nothing else was available. So two identification Asus machines died within a couple of months of each other. The proprietary 250GB SSDs used in them or smaller 125 GB SSDs are not available. I have also asked at an Asus repair facility in Bangkok and they also do not have a replacement available. My Asus days are done.

Yes! They are very reliable. I have used several Asus laptops. In my college years I used my friend's Asus. Recently,I've bought an Asus R558UQ-DM701D and I'm quite content with it. Recent Update: My Asus notebook was having issues with booting and loading OS. I went to the Service Center and addressed my problems. My device was repaired within 24 hours. Why should you go for Asus? Ranked III by laptopmag.com http://www.laptopmag.com/articles/laptop-brand-ratingsComes with 2 years of warrantyCheaper than other competitorsAlso comes with onsite warrantyAsus ROG series is one of the leading gaming notebook series.

Asus brings to its users an incredible range of premium, value and gaming systems with stunning design for every price. They are considered reliable products owing to a number of such factors. It’s metallic, minimalist designs are preferred by consumers. While, its compact Zephyrus and other gaming laptops showcased what a good a gaming rig can feel and look like. Right from entry-level VivoBooks to premium ZenBooks Asus manufactures quality products for every customer base. These laptops are mostly preferred by students, gamers, and budget-conscious customers. Therefore, you can purchase Asus laptops at no cost EMI across 60,000+ partner stores. All you need is your EMI Network card which converts the price of the product into monthly instalments. These can be paid off in flexible tenure of 3 to 24 months. You can book the product either via the customer portal or at the store by simply swiping your EMI Network card. Once booked, you can receive 24-hours, doorstep delivery for the product. It is interesting to note that existing users of the card can make use of pre-approved offers floated from time to time. These help users get the most out of the card. To know more of the same you can contact the store’s/ lender’s representative to guide you about the offers.

Some other brands like dell, Hp are more reliable as they have large number of users worldwide so comes the reliable factor with it and they are better in terms of looks and technicalities. But overall Asus are quite reliable and if one has a budget constraint then asus is a must go.It’s metallic, minimalist designs are preferred by consumers. i have 2 Asus laptop, one from 2011 and 2013. The first one busted when i am on field duty in 2013 (it is not a rugged laptop and i am a fool for using it when raining, in the jungle). After repair, that laptop served my sister for solid 4 years before suddenly died (and i haven’t got the chance to repair it).The second one that i bought in 2013 is still good and i am still using it for my daily driver (with upgraded ram and ssd). So yeah it is pretty reliable for my case.

Yes Asus laptops are reliable. Asus is a multi national computer and phone hardware and electronics company. It is a company with innovative ideas and technology. When it comes to laptops, reliablity of asus laptop is really great, their prices are also affordable. The real designs of Asus laptops keeps on inspiring us. The components of Asus laptops are worth spending the money. They are extremely affordable. You can also do multi tasking easily. You can find laptop for every one in every budget. Yes! I remember my friend’s Dell had way more quality when I bought my first Asus Laptop in 2007; but, Asus is much better now than Dell or maybe others. I remember everybody told me in my hometown of Iran to buy a Dell or HP in 2007 but I decided to buy Asus which was rare. Nowadays 70% of the people here buy Asus!

Asus laptops are in par with Dell in terms of build quality. In fact Asus over took the position of the second best brand next to apple pushing Dell to third. The high end laptops of Asus are great and are equally performance oriented as Dell. But the lower end laptops lack the same. This model of Asus is comparable with Dell vostro as both have the same configurations, while the former is bit cheaper by 2–3k. I suggest you if you can escalate the budget you can get the vostro 15 5568, which has some more features like optional SSD alongwith HDD, a fingerprint sensor, a backlight keyboard. If not required for you, then you can move on to this model. It's great

Dell has been ranked at higher reliability than Asus laptop. In my experience, design and hardware quality of Dell laptops is better than Asus laptops. In the budget of laptop Asus R558UQ, you could find some other DELL laptops with the less graphic capacity. Dell Insprion i5559 is one of them (6th Generation Intel Core i5-6200U, 8 GB RAM, 1 TB HDD). Another recommended laptop model in that budget is Lenovo Ideapad Miix 700 12″ (2-in-1 Laptop/Tablet (Intel m5, 12 8GB SDRAM, 256GB SSD, Windows 10). Miix 700 is the worth one to have.
